description: Intonation: Level of accuracy in all ranges and registers, pitch adjustments are made instantly
Mechanics: All notes, rhythms, and intervals are performed accurately
Language: Diction is consistently appropriate, consonants are clearly enunciated
Tone: Open, resonant, full tone in a registers and ranges, (in cases of a group performance: able to harmonise in chordal colour and group blend)
Breathing/Breath Support: Demonstrates ability to breathe deeply and control air flow consistently
Vowels: Vowel placement, even in outer ranges and volumes, remains consistent
Interpretation: Performance is delivered fully and deliberately, understanding of text is clear and stylistic choices reflect the meaning behind the text
Content: Performance adheres to theme, consists of blending and movement between rhythms, experimentation with vocal and musical textures, tessitura (vocal range) is diverse
Style/Elements: Expression is fluid and organic, versus rigid and mechanical
Phrasing: Phrasing is consistent and sensitive to the style of music being sung
Dynamics: Dynamic (volume) levels and contrast are obvious and consistent
Tempo: Rhythms performed are accurate and consistent with tempo
Showmanship, stage presence, body language, affective value and emotional impact, engagement with judges and audiences, and lasting thoughts on content, creativity, and technique
